<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always"> </p>
<hr style="color:#999999;height:3px;width:100%" />

<div style="text-align:center"><div style="width:8.5in;text-align:left;margin-left: auto;margin-right: auto">

<table style="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;border:0;width:100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<tr style="page-break-inside:avoid">
<td style="width:11%;vertical-align:top" align="left"><span style="font-weight:bold">Item&#160;7.01.</span></td>
<td align="left" style="vertical-align:top"> <p style=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;text-align:left">Regulation FD Disclosure. </p></td></tr></table> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and subsidiaries (collectively, &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;our&#8221; or &#8220;Mondel&#275;z International&#8221;) are furnishing this current report to provide supplemental <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial information related to the retrospective impact of (1)&#160;our sale of Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. (&#8220;KDP&#8221;) shares on August&#160;2, 2021, and (2)&#160;our sale of MaxFoods Pty Ltd (&#8220;MaxFoods&#8221;), an Australian packaged seafood business on November&#160;1, 2021. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Due to our reporting of KDP&#8217;s results on a <span style="white-space:nowrap">one-quarter</span> lag basis, the impact of the sale of the KDP shares will affect our <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial results beginning with our fourth quarter ended December&#160;31, 2021. Consistent with our definitions of our <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial measures, we will reflect the partial sale of our equity method investment in KDP as well as the sale of MaxFoods as divestitures. These changes will result in the recasting of our historical <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial results and provides additional information to facilitate comparisons of historical operating results, identify trends in our underlying operating results, and provide additional insight and transparency on how we evaluate our business. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold"><span style="font-style:italic">Change to our Historical <span style="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</span> Financial Results in Connection with our Sale of KDP Shares </span></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">As previously disclosed in our Quarterly Report on Form <span style="white-space:nowrap">10-Q</span> for the three months ended September&#160;30, 2021, we sold approximately 14.7&#160;million shares of KDP on August&#160;2, 2021, which reduced our ownership interest by 1.0% to 5.3% of the total outstanding shares. We received $500&#160;million of proceeds and recorded a <span style="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</span> gain of $248&#160;million (or $189&#160;million after tax) during the third quarter of 2021. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We consider the 1.0% ownership reduction resulting from this sale of shares a partial sale of our equity method investment in KDP. Consistent with our definitions of our <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial measures, we consider this sale to be a divestiture. Due to our reporting of KDP&#8217;s results on a <span style="white-space:nowrap">one-quarter</span> lag basis, the impact of the sale of these shares will affect our <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial results beginning with the fourth quarter ended December&#160;31, 2021. Therefore, we will remove the equity method investment net earnings results related to this partial sale of our equity method investment in KDP from our <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial results for Adjusted EPS for all historical periods presented. Our U.S. GAAP results, which include our historical equity method investment net earnings from KDP, will not change from what was previously reported. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold"><span style="font-style:italic">Change to our Historical <span style="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</span> Financial Results in Connection with our Sale of MaxFoods </span></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On November&#160;1, 2021, we completed the sale of MaxFoods, an Australian packaged foods business that we had recently acquired as part of our April&#160;1, 2021 acquisition of Gourmet Foods Holdings Pty Ltd. As a result of this divestiture, consistent with the definitions of our <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial measures, we will remove the results of this operation from our <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial results for Adjusted Gross Profit, Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted EPS for the second and third quarters of 2021 only, as these are the only quarters&#8217; results impacted by this divestiture. Our <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial measure for Organic Net Revenue for these periods will not change, as the net revenue from this business was previously included as net revenue from acquisitions which is already excluded from our Organic Net Revenue financial measure. Our U.S. GAAP results, which include the results of the divested operation through the divestiture closing date noted above, will not change from what was previously reported. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold"><span style="font-style:italic">Recast Amounts Reflecting Changes in Historical <span style="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</span> Results </span></p> <p style="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">See the summary chart below and Exhibit 99.1 for the unaudited GAAP and recast <span style="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</span> financial information for the first three quarters of 2021, all quarters of 2020 and 2019, the first nine months of 2021 and the years ended December&#160;31, 2020 and 2019. This supplemental disclosure does not amend any disclosure contained in any of our prior SEC filings. </p> <p style="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;text-align:center">Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;text-align:center">Recast Amounts Reflecting Change Due to Divestiture </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;text-align:center">(in millions of U.S. dollars, except per share data) </p> <p style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;text-align:center">(Unaudited) </p> <p style="line-height:3.0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:2pt;border-bottom:1px solid #000000">&#160;</p> <p style="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&#160;</p>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit 99.1 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>U.S. GAAP to Non-GAAP Reconciliations </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In addition to
reporting our U.S. GAAP operating results, we have historically reported non-GAAP financial information. Refer also to our Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q and our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the periods presented for additional information on our
GAAP to non-GAAP adjustments. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><U>Schedule 1.a </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>% Change&#151;Adjusted @ Constant FX (Non-GAAP)&#151;As Recast</B></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

tax assumptions associated with each item. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:18pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><U>Schedule 4.g </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Diluted EPS </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited)
</B></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="6" ALIGN="center" STYLE="border-bottom:1.00pt solid #000000"><B>For&nbsp;the&nbsp;Three&nbsp;Months&nbsp;Ended<BR>September&nbsp;30,</B></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>

</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><U>Schedule 4.h </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP to Non-GAAP Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Diluted EPS </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited)

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><B>&nbsp;</B></TD>

</DOCUMENT>
<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-99.2
<SEQUENCE>3
<FILENAME>d268420dex992.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-99.2
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>EX-99.2</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><B>Exhibit 99.2 </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> Financial Measures &#150; Additional Information </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We use <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial information and believe it is useful to investors as it provides additional information to
facilitate comparisons of historical operating results, identify trends in our underlying operating results, and provide additional insight and transparency on how we evaluate our business. We use <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT>
financial measures to budget, make operating and strategic decisions and evaluate our performance. We have detailed below the adjustments that we make in our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measure that was affected by
this partial sale of an equity method investment. Our adjustments generally fall within the following categories: acquisition&nbsp;&amp; divestiture activities, gains and losses on intangible asset sales and
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairments, major program restructuring activities, constant currency and related adjustments, major program financing and hedging activities and other major items affecting comparability of
operating results. We believe the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measures should always be considered along with the related U.S. GAAP financial measures. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The definitions of our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures did not change because of this partial sale of an equity method
investment and divested operation. For all periods presented in this Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">8-K,</FONT> our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measure Adjusted Gross Profit, Adjusted Operating Income and
Adjusted EPS are defined below. As new events or circumstances arise, this definition could change over time. When definitions change, we provide the updated definitions and present the related <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT>
historical results on a comparable basis&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Adjusted Gross Profit </I>&#150; defined as gross profit excluding the impacts of the Simplify to Grow Program&nbsp;<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(2)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; acquisition integration costs&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; the operating results of divestitures&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; and
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity, forecasted currency and equity method investment transaction derivative contracts&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(4)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">. We also present &#147;Adjusted Gross Profit margin,&#148; which is subject
to the same adjustments as Adjusted Gross Profit. We believe that Adjusted Gross Profit and Adjusted Gross Profit margin provide improved comparability of underlying operating results. We also evaluate growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted Gross
Profit on a constant currency basis&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(5)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income </I>&#150; defined as operating income (or segment operating income)
excluding the impacts of the items listed in the Adjusted Gross Profit definition as well as gains or losses (including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairment charges) on goodwill and intangible assets; divestiture&nbsp;<FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"> or acquisition gains or losses, divestiture-related&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt"> costs, acquisition-related costs, and acquisition integration costs and
contingent consideration adjustments; the operating results of divestitures&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; remeasurement of net monetary position&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(6)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; impacts from resolution of tax matters&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(7)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; CEO transition remuneration&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(8)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; impact from pension participation changes </FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(9)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; initial impacts from enacted tax law changes&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(10)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; and costs associated with the JDE Peet&#146;s transaction. We also present &#147;Adjusted Operating Income margin&#148; and &#147;Adjusted Segment Operating Income margin,&#148; which are subject
to the same adjustments as Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income. We believe that Adjusted Operating Income, Adjusted Segment Operating Income, Adjusted Operating Income margin and Adjusted Segment Operating Income margin
provide improved comparability of underlying operating results. We also evaluate growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income on a constant currency basis&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(5)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">.<I> </I> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:4%; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Adjusted EPS</I> &#150; defined as diluted EPS attributable to Mondel&#275;z International from continuing operations excluding the impacts
of the items listed in the Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Operating Income definitions as well as losses on debt extinguishment and related expenses; gains or losses on interest rate swaps no longer designated as accounting cash flow hedges
due to changed financing and hedging plans; net earnings from divestitures&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">; and gains or losses on equity method investment transactions. Similarly, within Adjusted EPS, our equity method investment net earnings exclude our proportionate share of our investees&#146;
significant operating and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-operating</FONT> items&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(11)</SUP></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">. We believe that Adjusted EPS provides improved comparability of underlying operating results. We also evaluate growth in our Adjusted EPS on a constant currency basis&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:6pt"><SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(5)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt">. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(1)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">When items no longer impact our current or future presentation of
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> operating results, we remove these items from our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> definitions. In the second quarter of 2021, we added to the
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> definitions the exclusion of initial impacts from enacted tax law changes. Refer to footnote (9)&nbsp;below. In the third quarter of 2021, we also added the exclusion of contingent consideration
adjustments (refer to footnote (3)&nbsp;below) and the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from equity method investment transaction derivative contracts (see footnote
(4)&nbsp;below). </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(2)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> adjustments related to the Simplify to Grow Program reflect
costs incurred that relate to the objectives of our program to transform our supply chain network and organizational structure. Costs that do not meet the program objectives are not reflected in the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT>
adjustments. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(3)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">Divestitures include completed sales of businesses (including the partial or full sale of an equity method
investment) and exits of major product lines upon completion of a sale or licensing agreement. As we record our share of KDP and JDE Peet&#146;s ongoing earnings on a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-quarter</FONT> lag basis, any KDP or JDE
Peet&#146;s ownership reductions are reflected as divestitures within our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results the following quarter. During the third </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="9%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">
quarter of 2021, we began to exclude the impact of certain adjustments made to our acquisition contingent consideration liabilities that were recorded at the date of acquisition. We made this
adjustment to better facilitate comparisons of our underlying operating performance across periods. Refer to Note 2, <I>Acquisitions and Divestitures</I>, and Note 6, <I>Equity Method Investments</I>, in our Quarterly Report on Form <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-Q</FONT> for the quarter ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 for more information on acquisitions and divestitures impacting the comparability of our results. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(4)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">We exclude unrealized gains and losses
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts) from outstanding commodity and forecasted currency and equity method investment transaction derivatives from our
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures. The <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts are excluded until such time that the related exposures impact our
operating results. Since we purchase commodity and forecasted currency contracts to mitigate price volatility primarily for inventory requirements in future periods, we make this adjustment to remove the volatility of these future inventory
purchases on current operating results to facilitate comparisons of our underlying operating performance across periods. We exclude equity method investment transaction derivative contract settlements as they represent protection of value for future
divestitures. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(5)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">Constant currency operating results are calculated by dividing or multiplying, as appropriate, the
current-period local currency operating results by the currency exchange rates used to translate the financial statements in the comparable prior-year period to determine what the current-period U.S. dollar operating results would have been if the
currency exchange rate had not changed from the comparable prior-year period. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(6)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">During the third quarter of 2018, as we began to apply highly inflationary accounting for Argentina, we
excluded the remeasurement gains or losses related to remeasuring net monetary assets or liabilities in Argentina during the period to be consistent with our prior accounting for these remeasurement gains/losses for Venezuela when it was subject to
highly inflationary accounting prior to deconsolidation in 2015. Refer to Note 1, <I>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</I>, in our Annual Report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2020
for additional information. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(7)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">Refer to Note 14, <I>Commitments and Contingencies &#150; Tax Matters, </I>in our Annual Report on Form <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2020 for additional information. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(8)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">On November&nbsp;20, 2017, Dirk Van de Put succeeded Irene Rosenfeld as CEO of Mondel&#275;z International in
advance of her retirement at the end of March 2018. In order to incent Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put to join us, we provided him compensation with a total combined target value of $42.5&nbsp;million to make him whole for incentive awards he forfeited or
grants that were not made to him when he left his former employer. The compensation we granted took the form of cash, deferred stock units, performance share units and stock options. In connection with Irene Rosenfeld&#146;s retirement, we made her
outstanding grants of performance share units for the 2016-2018 and 2017-2019 performance cycles eligible for continued vesting and approved a $0.5&nbsp;million salary for her service as Chairman from January through March 2018. We refer to these
elements of Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put&#146;s and Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s compensation arrangements together as &#147;CEO transition remuneration.&#148; We are excluding amounts we expense as CEO transition remuneration from our 2017 and future <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results because those amounts are not part of our regular compensation program and are incremental to amounts we would have incurred as ongoing CEO compensation. As a result, in 2017, we excluded amounts
expensed for the cash payment to Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put and partial vesting of his equity grants. In 2018, we excluded amounts paid for Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s service as Chairman and partial vesting of Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put&#146;s and
Ms.&nbsp;Rosenfeld&#146;s equity grants. In 2019, we excluded amounts related to the partial vesting of Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put&#146;s equity grants. During the first quarter of 2020, Mr.&nbsp;Van de Put&#146;s equity grants became fully vested.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(9)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">The impact from pension participation changes represents the charges incurred when employee groups are
withdrawn from multiemployer pension plans and other changes in employee group pension plan participation. We exclude these charges from our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> results because those amounts do not reflect our ongoing
pension obligations. See Note 10, <I>Benefit Plans</I>, in our Quarterly Report on Form <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-Q</FONT> for the quarter ended September&nbsp;30, 2021 for more information on the multiemployer pension plan withdrawal.
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(10)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">We have excluded the initial impacts from enacted tax law changes. Initial impacts include items such as the
remeasurement of deferred tax balances and the transition tax from the 2017 U.S. tax reform. Previously, we only excluded the initial impacts from more material tax reforms, specifically the impacts of the 2019 Swiss tax reform and 2017 U.S. tax
reform. We exclude initial impacts from enacted tax law changes from our Adjusted EPS as they do not reflect our ongoing tax obligations under the enacted tax law changes. Refer to Note 16, <I>Income Taxes</I>, in our Annual Report on Form <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2020 for more information on the impact of Swiss and U.S. tax reform. </P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="4%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(11)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE=" margin-top:0pt ; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman; " ALIGN="left">We have excluded our proportionate share of our equity method investees&#146; significant operating and <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-operating</FONT> items, such as acquisition and divestiture related costs, restructuring program costs and initial impacts from enacted tax law changes, in order to provide investors with a comparable view of our
performance across periods. Although we have shareholder rights and board representation commensurate with our ownership interests in our equity method investees and review the underlying operating results and significant operating and <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-operating</FONT> items with them each reporting period, we do not have direct control over their operations or resulting revenue and expenses. Our use of equity method investment net earnings on an adjusted basis is
not intended to imply that we have any such control. Our GAAP &#147;diluted EPS attributable to Mondel&#275;z International from continuing operations&#148; includes all of the investees&#146; significant operating and
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-operating</FONT> items. </P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV></Center>


<p style="margin-top:1em; margin-bottom:0em; page-break-before:always">
<HR SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<Center><DIV STYLE="width:8.5in" align="left">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">We believe that the presentation of these <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial
measures, when considered together with our U.S. GAAP financial measures and the reconciliations to the corresponding U.S. GAAP financial measures, helps provide a more complete understanding of the factors and trends affecting our business than
could be obtained absent these disclosures. Because <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures vary among companies, the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures presented in this report may not be
comparable to similarly titled measures used by other companies. Our use of these <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures is not meant to be considered in isolation or as a substitute for any U.S. GAAP financial measure.
A limitation of the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures is they do not include all items of income and expense that affect us and have an impact on our U.S. GAAP reported results. The best way to address this
limitation is by evaluating our <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures in combination with our U.S. GAAP reported results and carefully evaluating the reconciliations of U.S. GAAP reported figures to the <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures. </P>
</DIV></Center>

<SEQUENCE>11
<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<TYPE>XML
<SEQUENCE>12
<FILENAME>report.css
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
